lines.text: He's big, but, remember this, they all look alike in a Turkish bath.
Well, if I break loose and run around with a lot of men and get drunk, I may get a glimpse of you, occasionally, through a Gin bottle.
What's he got against you?
Well, I, I'm - too wild. I drink too much. Run around too much. Too many men.
What kind of men?
Any kind!
Why, you don't look as wild as that.
See me later today and you'll think so. I'm going to knock this town right off its pins.
Remember, I'm out to break the bad reputation record.
Say, what's the matter? Its so quiet around here. Ain't we supposed to be havin' some fun? Hey, Pinkie, turn on the radio and we'll make a little whoopie.
Right, ol' boy, ol' boy, ol' boy, ol' boy.
Hey kid, wanna dance?
Go ahead, Modesty, I bet you're still doing the minuet.
Say, I won a loving cup in Toledo last year with a Black Bottom.

[Sarcastically]
I bet your mother's proud of you.
I haven't any mother.
Oh, another one of those dames without a mother. So that's our alibi. You'll be telling me next you never had a chance.
What's she like Ruby?
Something like me if she was better looking.
Laugh while you can. Because birds like you don't laugh long.
And listen, I don't want to hear no unfamiliar noises in the night.
What kind of noises are you familiar with, dear?
Why do I take such chances?
Oh, we can't lose. The guy that wired me - *owns* the horse. He sleeps with him!
A man sleeping with a horse, don't prove nothin', mister!
You ought to know. Yeah, you ought to know.
I'll have the operator phone you when the race is over; but, I'm tellin' you a horse with a name like 'Bashful Bridegroom' ain't got a chance.
He changed my evening stroll from an exercise to - to an occupation. Does that filter through?

On his last trip to Detroit, I walk in on him and a blonde - bleary blonde at that. I ordered her out and she laughed. I told him to put her out and he laughed. And in the end they tossed me out like last night's bottles.
Nobody was ever crazy about each other like Ben and me. Sometimes - it was kinda spiritual.
What a flat tire I turned out to be.
Alright, you better go now. The boys have to get some rest so they can work tomorrow. If they don't sell goods, they don't eat.
Yep. Me too. So long, suckers.
